name: 4'-(methylthio)acetophenone
Reason: 4'-(methylthio)acetophenone has a melting point that we can compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methylthio group, which introduces a sulfur atom and the associated rigid structure, estimated at around +10°C. Additionally, the methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, estimated at around +5°C. The acetophenone group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
